item.title: Maria add a quote by Jello Biafra
item.description: "I enjoy getting people angry and getting underneath their skin, especially people who don't think." -- Jello Biafra

item.title: Maria add a quote by Juana de Ibarbarou
item.description: "(translated) Charon, I shall be a scandal upon your barge. While other shades pray, moan, or cry... I shall be as a swallow singing down the river and radiate upon the waves of that sombre river like a blue lantern that alights that voyage. " -- Juana de Ibarbarou

item.title: Maria add a quote by Maria Luisa Bombal
item.description:
"Para ser inteligente, hay que empezar desde chica.
To be intelligent, one must start young." -- Maria Luisa Bombal

item.title: Maria add a quote by Marta Traba
item.description:
"La cuestion esta en decidirse en algo, alguna vez.
The gist is in deciding on something, at some time." -- Marta Traba

item.title: Maria add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Maria add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Maria add a quote by Yogi Berra
item.description: "When you come to a fork in the road take it" -- Yogi Berra

item.title: Maria add a quote by Gina Nahai
item.description: "...the most real presence of all is the abscence of those we love." -- Gina Nahai

item.title: Maria add a quote by Gina Nahai
item.description: "it's an even bargain -one in which we both lose." -- Gina Nahai

item.title: Maria add a quote by Gina B. Nahai
item.description: "...we are all waiting for the luminous hands that will reach for us in the night, the eyes that will witness our pain, the voice that will whisper the possibility of a different truth." -- Gina B. Nahai

item.title: Maria add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Maria add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Now, look, baby, 'Union' is spelled with 5 letters. It is not a four-letter word." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Maria add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Heterosexuality is not normal, it's just common." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Maria add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "You can lead a horticulture, but you can't make her think." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Maria add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Oh, life is a glorious cycle of song, a medley of extemporanea, And love is a thing that can never go wrong, and I am Marie of Romania." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Maria add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "<b>Résumé</b> Razors pain you, Rivers are damp, Acids stain you, And drugs cause cramp. Guns aren't lawful, Nooses give, Gas smells awful. You might as well live." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Maria add a quote by Eugene V. Debs
item.description: "While there is a lower class, I am in it, while there is a criminal element, I am of it, and while there is a soul in prison, I am not free." -- Eugene V. Debs

item.title: Maria add a quote by Eugene V. Debs
item.description: "Intelligent discontent is the mainspring of civilization." -- Eugene V. Debs

item.title: Maria add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Maria add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "Before we can forgive one another, we have to understand one another." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Maria add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The hottest places in hell are reserved for those who, in times of great moral crisis, maintain their neutrality." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Maria add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "Love is like the sea. It's a moving thing, but still and all, it takes its shape from the shore it meets, and it's different with every shore." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Maria add a quote by Cesar Chavez
item.description:
"Once social change begins, it cannot be reversed. You cannot un-educate the person who has learned to read. You cannot humiliate the person who feels pride. You cannot oppress the people who are not afraid anymore.
Cesar Chavez Address to the Commonwealth Club in San Francisco, Nov. 9, 1984 " -- Cesar Chavez

item.title: Maria add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "Las masas humanas más peligrosas son aquellas en cuyas venas ha sido inyectado el veneno del miedo… del miedo al cambio" -- Octavio Paz
